title: Sri Lanka stocks end 6-pct higher amid rupee float
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks soared over 6 percent on Thursday (10) after the central bank allowed the local currency to float from a pegged 200 rupees, market data showed.
On Thursday, rupee opened at 240/260 in the interbank market and went up as much as 275/285 before easing.
In the kerb market dollar was at 249 rupees before the float of the rupee which was kept at 200 to the US dollar and was hit by sterilized intervention and a subsidy given to foreign remittances.
The (ASPI), gained 692.35 points to close at 10,856.07.  However, in the last three days index has already lost over 9.6 percent.
Dealers said the rupee float pushed the market up as the main retail counters are dollar earners.
S&P SL20 of the most liquid stocks is also rose 9.46 percent or 325.32 points to 3,763.57 points.
The market turnover was 3.5 billion rupees, around half of this year’s average turnover of 5.9 billion rupees.
Expolanka, LOLC Holdings and Browns Investment pushed the main index up on Thursday.
The market heavyweight gained 19.56 percent to close at 287.25 rupees a share while LOLC Holdings rose 10.18 percent to close at 876.75 rupees a share, market data showed.
Browns Investment closed 17.53 percent up at 11.40 rupees a share. (Colombo/March10/2022)
